job.title: Software Engineer
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Commercial Real Estate,Computer Software
job.description:
Berkadia, a joint venture of Berkshire Hathaway and Jefferies Financial Group, is a leader in the commercial real estate industry, offering a robust suite of services to our multifamily and commercial property clients. Powered by deep relationships and industry-changing technology, our people sell, finance, and service commercial real estate, providing support for the entire life cycle of our clients’ assets. Our unique ownership structure allows us to put the client’s interests first and creates a marketplace that delivers a superior experience.
Software Engineer
MEAN - Full Stack
Position Summary
The Software Engineer will provide technical leadership within team responsible for architecting, adapting, and implementing software solutions that support enterprise-wide business strategies and objectives.
Responsibilities
Analyze requirements and collaborate with the product owners, team members and architects to design and implement solutions
Use TDD practices to build and test code to validate functionality against requirements and to ensure quality software
Document designs and code to the right level to accurately estimate complexity and time in an agile fashion
Iterate through incremental software development lifecycle wherein priorities, requirements and scope evolve, sometimes rapidly, over time and often mid-project (be agile)
Demonstrate self-development by staying current with new technology and design patterns
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Development using MEAN OR MERN stack with React.js, Angular 7.0 and a Node backend
An understanding of developing software (both frontends and backend), and an understanding of software development practices in an enterprise environment
Experience using difference SaaS technologies/stacks/modules and understanding of which are best when implementing RESTful microservices, with an emphasis on latest Node/Express and unit testing using Mocha/Chai
Experience using different JavaScript frontend frameworks/tools/libraries with an emphasis on latest Angular
Passionate about developing quality products that exceed users’ expectations
Understanding of development best practices including TDD, CI/CD
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills as well as strong logical, analytical, problem solving skills and reporting skills.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
Employee Benefits
18 PTO days + 2 floating holidays & 10 paid holidays per year
Generous tuition reimbursement towards a Masters or Bachelors degree
12 weeks of 100% paid paternity/maternity leave
Mentorship with industry professionals
